private_information: I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
you.goal: Meet as many friends as possible during the day.

private_information: I will be at Nob Hill from 11:30 to 15:15
I require a minimum meeting duration of 75 minutes
My meeting location is Nob Hill
joseph.goal: Meet the visitor for at least 75 minutes while I am at Nob Hill.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes travel times, time windows, and meeting duration constraints so the best visiting schedule can be found.

public_information: Travel time Chinatown to Nob Hill is 8 minutes
Travel time Nob Hill to Chinatown is 6 minutes

report.system_prompt: You are the visiting person. Provide a concise structured report of your start location, arrival time, available time window for meetings, and any scheduling preferences. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is you. Using your private information and the environment public information, produce a clear structured report that states your starting location, arrival time at the start location, overall availability window for the day, and any preferences that affect meeting order or duration. The report should be suitable for the orchestrator to consume.

report.system_prompt: You are Joseph. Provide a concise structured report of your location, availability window, and required minimum meeting duration. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is joseph. Using your private information and the environment public information, produce a clear structured report that states your location, the start and end times you will be available at that location, and the minimum meeting duration you require. The report should be suitable for the orchestrator to consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownwards solver. You will receive structured reports from agents. Your task is to integrate all available information and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem tuned for FastDownwards that encodes locations, asymmetric travel durations, the arrival time at Chinatown, time windows for availability, and the required meeting duration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the public information and the agents' reports to build a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Model discrete time in minutes, include locations Chinatown and Nob Hill, include asymmetric travel durations (Chinatown to Nob Hill 8, Nob Hill to Chinatown 6), include the visitor arrival at Chinatown at 09:00, include Joseph's availability window 11:30 to 15:15 at Nob Hill, and encode the constraint that a meeting with Joseph must last at least 75 minutes. Provide a domain then a problem, enclosed in <domain> and <problem> tags. Keep predicates and actions clear so FastDownwards can process the files.
